Incident.Summary: The suspect became prohibited from possessing firearms but possessed a Handgun Permit and had multiple firearms registered in MAFSS.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
This incident was captured on MSP issued Body Worn Camera.      

     On September 25, 2023, ST Barnas # 6328 of MSP Licensing Division – HQL Unit completed an HQL Revocation for Timothy Brian Payne (W/M, DOB: 06/10/1977) due to him becoming disqualified from possessing firearms and ammunition.  Payne was found to have been convicted guilty of Assault Second Degree (Domestic) on 09/21/2023 in the Circuit Court for St. Mary’s County (Case # C18CR000284).  Payne was found to have seven regulated firearms registered in MAFSS.  This information was forwarded to the Maryland Gun Center where the prohibited status was confirmed and further research indicated all but one firearm had been seized by the St. Mary’s County Sheriff’s Office.  This case was forwarded to ST S. DiToto #5416 for further action.

     ST S. DiToto reviewed the above information and through further investigation found Payne was also the respondent on a Final Protective Order (D043FM23000202) in effect until 07/13/2024.  It was further found that on July 11, 2023 upon issuance of an Interim Extreme Risk Protective Order, St. Mary’s County Sheriff’s Office responded to Payne’s residence at 40450 Shady Lane, Mechanicsville, St. Mary’s County, Maryland, where the order was served and sixteen regulated and non-regulated firearms were seized.  ST S. DiToto contacted SMCSO Property Specialist C. Ferrari, who confirmed the firearms were in custody of the Sheriff’s Office and provided copies of the related property records.  ST S. DiToto searched social media and several law enforcement resources, but no further information or evidence was located regarding the remaining firearm or Payne’s possession of any additional firearms.  The remaining firearm was identified as a Ruger Vaquero .45 caliber revolver (SN: 05771702).  It was determined Payne currently resides with a relative at 27320 Harpers Court, Mechanicsville, Maryland.

     On October 4, 2023 at approximately 0659 hours, ST S. DiToto and Trooper Lewis #7660 (MSP Leonardtown Barrack), conducted a knock and talk at 27320 Harpers Court, Mechanicsville, Maryland.  Troopers contacted Timothy Payne who advised he was aware he is now disqualified from possessing firearms.  He stated on October 3, 2023 he attempted to surrender his Maryland Handgun Permit at Leonardtown Barrack and to gather further instruction on what he needed to do about his firearms.  Payne asked to surrender his Handgun Permit (#22HGP-060299).  ST S. DiToto took possession of the permit and forwarded it to MSP Licensing Division – HGP Section via internal department mail.  Payne advised all firearms were in the possession of the St. Mary’s County Sheriff’s Office and he stated he had no access to any other firearms.  Payne was questioned about the remaining Ruger Vaquero (SN: 05771702) transferred in 2000.  Payne stated he gave that handgun to a subject he knew as Kirk Cantrel (W/M, Approx. 70 years old) of Lusby, Maryland who he had done professional work with.  Payne stated this occurred at a location he could not recall and on a non-specific date longer than ten years ago.  Payne stated Cantrel intended to keep the firearm and he provided contact information for Cantrel. 

     ST S. DiToto identified the subject based on information provided as Kirk David Cantrel (W/M, DOB: 08/27/1947) of 256 Elkins Lane, Lusby, Calvert County, Maryland.  Cantrel was found to already possess several firearms in MAFSS and to not be prohibited from possessing firearms.  On October 4, 2023 at approximately 0907 hours, ST S. DiToto contacted Cantrel who confirmed he possessed the firearm, which was locked in the safe inside his residence.  Cantrel was provided with instruction on how to complete the transfer process and he advised he would comply promptly.  Follow-up will be conducted to ensure the firearm transfer was completed.  Based on the evidence and information gathered, Payne did not illegally possess firearms and no other criminal violation was identified. Case closed unfounded.

Above events occurred in St. Mary’s and Calvert County, Maryland.
